update.description:
Implementation of the Physics Preset Profile API [design](#!/osrf/gazebo_design/src/e64787224f59902a986c22f7d20fdb39e24b8764/physics_presets/physics_presets.md).

Requires sdformat [PR146](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/146/physics-preset-attributes/diff)

This PR adds an API for switching between different physics profiles, specified as physics blocks in SDF.

I also included 2 small fixes the ODEPhysics and SimbodyPhysics to handle exceptions.

A forthcoming PR will implement the command line interface to `PresetManager` ([preview](#!/osrf/gazebo/branch/physics_presets_cli))

Known issue(s):

The implementation of `PresetManager` relies on `PhysicsEngine::SetParam`. `SetParam` is not implemented for Simbody, so the functionality of this PR will not work with Simbody. (If/when [PR1473](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1473/) gets merged before this, I will complete the `PresetManager` test to include Simbody.

For all the physics engines, `SetParam` is not fully implemented for certain parameters, so you may receive lots of gzwarnings from the `PhysicsEngine` implementation in gzserver.
update.title: `PresetManager` for physics library

content.raw: It doesn't have to be fixed now; sounds great.
content.html: It doesn't have to be fixed now; sounds great.

content.html: Yeah, I can move the TODO and fix this in a future pull request, in the interest of not making this one longer. (I'm making another PresetManager PR after this to implement the command line interface anyway.)

content.html: Maybe we could move this to the relevant part of the .cc file that would check this?

content.html: Hmm, I think I was trying to say that the Preset class should only store a pointer to an SDF element that represents a Physics element.

content.html: I think we usually put the & characters next to the variable: string &_name

content.html: What does this mean?

content.raw:
http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_from_source&ver=4.0&cat=install#OptionalPhysicsEngines
~~~
    sudo apt-add-repository ppa:libccd-debs
    sudo apt-add-repository ppa:fcl-debs
    sudo apt-add-repository ppa:dartsim
    sudo apt-get update
    sudo apt-get install libdart-core4-dev
~~~
content.html:
http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_from_source&ver=4.0&cat=install#OptionalPhysicsEngines

    sudo apt-add-repository ppa:libccd-debs
    sudo apt-add-repository ppa:fcl-debs
    sudo apt-add-repository ppa:dartsim
    sudo apt-get update
    sudo apt-get install libdart-core4-dev

I was seeing a test failure with dart:
~~~
[ RUN      ] PhysicsEngines/PresetManagerTest.InitializeAllPhysicsEngines/3
[Msg] Waiting for master.
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Publicized address: 172.23.2.90
[Wrn] [DARTPhysics.cc:469] accuracy is not supported in DART
[Wrn] [DARTPhysics.cc:469] cfm is not supported in DART
[Wrn] [DARTPhysics.cc:469] contact_max_correcting_vel is not supported in DART
[Wrn] [DARTPhysics.cc:469] contact_surface_layer is not supported in DART
[Wrn] [DARTPhysics.cc:469] erp is not supported in DART
[Wrn] [DARTPhysics.cc:469] gravity is not supported in DART
[Wrn] [DARTPhysics.cc:469] iters is not supported in DART
[Wrn] [DARTPhysics.cc:469] magnetic_field is not supported in DART
[Wrn] [DARTPhysics.cc:469] max_transient_velocity is not supported in DART
[Err] [DARTPhysics.cc:450] Setting [min_step_size] in DART to [0.001] not yet supported.
[Wrn] [DARTPhysics.cc:469] real_time_factor is not supported in DART
[Wrn] [DARTPhysics.cc:469] real_time_update_rate is not supported in DART
[Wrn] [DARTPhysics.cc:469] sor is not supported in DART
[Wrn] [DARTPhysics.cc:469] split_impulse is not supported in DART
[Wrn] [DARTPhysics.cc:469] split_impulse_penetration_threshold is not supported in DART
[Wrn] [DARTPhysics.cc:469] type is not supported in DART
[Wrn] [DARTPhysics.cc:469] use_dynamic_moi_rescaling is not supported in DART
[Dbg] [ServerFixture.cc:144] ServerFixture load in 1.1 seconds, timeout after 600 seconds
Error [SDF.cc:789] Missing element description for [dart]
[Err] [DARTPhysics.cc:394] DART SDF element not found, unable to get param [min_step_size]
/home/scpeters/ws/gazebo_sdformat/src/gazebo/test/integration/physics_presets.cc:87: Failure
Failed
[Dbg] [ServerFixture.cc:95] ServerFixture::Unload
[  FAILED  ] PhysicsEngines/PresetManagerTest.InitializeAllPhysicsEngines/3, where GetParam() = "dart" (1230 ms)
~~~
I fixed it in ef9cac0dea3d

update.description:
Implementation of the Physics Preset Profile API [design](#!/osrf/gazebo_design/src/e64787224f59902a986c22f7d20fdb39e24b8764/physics_presets/physics_presets.md).

Requires sdformat [PR146](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/146/physics-preset-attributes/diff)

This PR adds an API for switching between different physics profiles, specified as physics blocks in SDF.

I also included 2 small fixes the ODEPhysics and SimbodyPhysics to handle exceptions.

A forthcoming PR will implement the command line interface to `PresetManager` ([preview](#!/osrf/gazebo/branch/physics_presets_cli))

Known issue(s):

The implementation of `PresetManager` relies on `PhysicsEngine::SetParam`. `SetParam` is not implemented for Simbody, so the functionality of this PR will not work with Simbody. (If/when [PR1473](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1473/) gets merged before this, I will complete the `PresetManager` test to include Simbody.

For all the physics engines, `SetParam` is not fully implemented for certain parameters, so you may receive lots of gzwarnings from the `PhysicsEngine` implementation in gzserver.
update.title: `PresetManager` for physics library

content.raw:
There's a [cpplint error in the test](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/559/cppcheckResult/). It seems spurious to me, but I don't think we can suppress cpplint errors.

It's complaining about "Missing spaces around =" in the sdf string constant. Is there an easy way to tweak the string constant to fix this?
content.html:
There's a cpplint error in the test. It seems spurious to me, but I don't think we can suppress cpplint errors.

It's complaining about "Missing spaces around =" in the sdf string constant. Is there an easy way to tweak the string constant to fix this?

update.description:
Implementation of the `Physics Preset Profile API` [design](#!/osrf/gazebo_design/src/e64787224f59902a986c22f7d20fdb39e24b8764/physics_presets/physics_presets.md).

Requires sdformat [PR146](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/146/physics-preset-attributes/diff)

This PR adds an API for switching between different physics profiles, specified as physics blocks in SDF.

I also included 2 small fixes the ODEPhysics and SimbodyPhysics to handle exceptions.

A forthcoming PR will implement the command line interface to `PresetManager` ([preview](#!/osrf/gazebo/branch/physics_presets_cli))

Known issue(s):

The implementation of `PresetManager` relies on `PhysicsEngine::SetParam`. `SetParam` is not implemented for SImbody, so the functionality of this PR will not work with Simbody. For all the physics engines, `SetParam` is not fully implemented for certain parameters, so you may receive lots of gzwarnings from the `PhysicsEngine` implementation in gzserver.
update.title: `PresetManager` for physics library

update.description:
Implementation of the `Physics Preset Profile API` [design](#!/osrf/gazebo_design/src/e64787224f59902a986c22f7d20fdb39e24b8764/physics_presets/physics_presets.md).

Requires sdformat [pull request #146](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/146/physics-preset-attributes/diff)

This PR adds an API for switching between different physics profiles, specified as physics blocks in SDF.

I also included 2 small fixes the ODEPhysics and SimbodyPhysics to handle exceptions.

A forthcoming PR will implement the command line interface to `PresetManager` ([preview](#!/osrf/gazebo/branch/physics_presets_cli))

Known issue(s):

The implementation of `PresetManager` relies on `PhysicsEngine::SetParam`. `SetParam` is not implemented for SImbody, so this PR is not compatible with Simbody. `SetParam` is not fully implemented for certain parameters, so you may receive lots of gzwarnings from the `PhysicsEngine` implementation (probably `ODEPhysics` if you don't specify it.
